title: Ban for using AutoHotKey?
body:
I wonder, can people be banned if they are reported for cheating, but all they are doing is using an AutoHotKey script to follow other champs and get assists while they do something else?
A person I know is doing that now, and I'm worried they'll get banned. (Of course, they deserve it but I'd like to know if ahk scripts are considered cheats)

replies.body: If that's what they're using it for, it's absolutely not allowed and they can be banned for it. Any automation of gameplay is not allowed.

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=wNmd2EJL,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-04-07T01:17:24.367+0000)
>
> If that's what they're using it for, it's absolutely not allowed and they can be banned for it. Any automation of gameplay is not allowed.

If I use AutoHotkey to disable my chat is that going to get me banned?
Is there any human intervention when it comes to reports like that? I'd actually like to report them in Support...
Do note though, they may not face an immediate punishment as they usually ban script/bots in waves.

You can certainly report through a ticket, as zPOOPz linked. Most bans for 3rd party app abuse would the result of red flags the automated system triggers, and you should definitely use the in-game report too, but some probably fall through the cracks and a manual report couldn't hurt.
I know that reports due to toxicity are mostly automated, that's why I'd like to know.
yes... how is this even a question?
Of course it's bannable. Are you telling me it doesn't seem like blatant botting/cheating to you?

Yes you can definitely get banned for scripting, they're also considered a form of cheating even if you aren't reading or editing any memory.
Most "cheats" are actually just scripts these days.
Does it make it so that the person in question does not have to control what it is they do every time.... due to a third party program? If so, then yes they can be.
